snippet: The agency set up to protect consumers appears to be allowing high upfront fees for credit card issuers.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau introduces proposal that will make it easier for credit card issuers to charge fees before borrowers accounts are officially open; proposed rule is in response to a federal court decision that challenged how the Credit Card Act was being applied; many consumer advocates question why the agency is not taking a more aggressive stand against fees.
lead_paragraph: The agency set up to protect consumers appears to be allowing high upfront fees for credit card issuers.

headline.seo: Consumer Agency Seems to Soften Limit on Credit Cards Fees
headline.main: Consumer Bureau Declines to Resist Upfront Credit Card Fees
headline.print_headline: Consumer Bureau Declines to Resist Upfront Credit Card Fees

keywords.value: Credit Card Accountability, Responsibility and Disclosure Act (2009)
keywords.name: subject
